Project: Alternative Financing Models for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy in South African Municipalities
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Municipal Training programme and city-to-city learning exchange for Embedded Generation of Renewable Energy and Climate Finance
Description:
Relevant municipal officials will be identified by each municipality (most likely from the electricity, urban planning and infrastructure departments) (3-4 officials per municipality, a total of 12 - 16 people per session). It is preferred that the same officials from each municipality attends every training session as the training sessions will build on one another. The municipal training programme consists of 6 structured half-day online events where municipal officials will be trained on a variety of topics related to renewable energy, embedded generation, climate change, and climate finance. This is required to enhance the skills of municipal officials and build capacity for the implementation and replication of these projects. This training will predominantly be held virtually, with one in-person session.

An overview of the training sessions is provided below:
a. Session 1: An introduction to climate change, NDCs and the Just Transition
b. Session 2: A Just Transition approach to renewable energy planning in the South African context
c. Session 3: Gender considerations for renewable energy and climate change
d. Session 4 (3-day workshop): The importance of renewable energy embedded generation and its co-benefits; The principles of renewable energy embedded generation policy development; Strategic planning and renewable energy embedded generation policy: Goal setting, monitoring and evaluation, Energy data collection 
e. Session 5: Introduction to climate finance and an exploration of finance models for the renewable energy embedded generation projects
f. Session 6: Key considerations to undertake a pre-feasibility study for a renewable energy embedded generation project

Each session will be developed further once the capacity assessment is complete.

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Sustainable Finance Taxonomy Report
Description:
A technical document containing the following:
- An enhanced Phase-1 catalogue and standards of nationally-relevant green activities/innovation needs with more granular criteria, guidance and metrics for complex activities
- An advanced transition finance taxonomy (as sub-component of the green finance taxonomy), with explicit guidance, catalogue and criteria; informed by technology and sector decarbonisation pathways, sustainability-linked instruments; consensus on minimum roadmap requirements; green default monitoring processes
- A Social Finance Taxonomy, with a distinct catalogue and standards for social and socio-economic development activities aligned to and to transition to a green economy with recognition/ requirements, criteria, thresholds and just transition models;
- A non-compatible finance taxonomy: taxonomic exclusion principles; catalogue and criteria of activities, technologies and products that do significant environmental harm; process for reallocation from ‘transition’ to ‘non-compatible’ taxonomies

Project: Expanding the South African Green Finance Taxonomy and embedding its use

Project: Capacity Building for Green Investment and the GIP
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Green Finance Training Session for Central Asia
Description:
The output will be delivered as an training session which will be tailored with local heated topics and market situation. The main objectives of this training session will  include:
1) Encouragement of green investment among financial institutions in Central Asia
2)Enhanced climate and environmental risk management capabilities
3)Communication among all key stakeholders for sharing the best practice in green finance
4) Tailored regional questions to be answered, such as how financial inclusion help to solve the local social problems or specific high carbon industries (energy, transport) could deal with transition risks
More details on number of training participants and event duration are to be confirmed taking into consideration the latest development of COVID distruption.
Implementor: Beijing Institute of Finance and Sustainability

Participants will share information, express a common voice on areas of mutual interest. The attendees are expected to be in the range of 15-20, and the workshops will last for 2-3 hours.

The Assurance Roundtable is to provide a collaborative platform for Chinese green bond verifiers and prospective verifiers to share first-hand experiences and discuss the principles, approaches and practicalities of the Chinese and international green bond standards and certification scheme, in order to enhance capacity. The CBI team will also present on the progress of industry standards for climate bond certification, other regional/intl standards, and the key findings of the CBI issue papers.

The recommendations will be submitted to the Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division, to support the following key performance indicator within the Green Transport Strategy: Develop guidelines for the procurement of vehicles throughout government to procure efficient vehicles, using clean energy technologies. The recommendations will be targeting: Department of Transport: Integrated Transport Planning Division; National Treasury: Senior Management responsible for Strategic Planning and Senior Staff within the Government Technical Advisory Centre; Department of Trade, Industry and Competition: Senior Management within the Industrial Development Division: Green Industries, Automotive Sector; Department of Environment, Forestry and Fisheries: Senior Management within the Climate Change and Air Quality Branch.

The training webinar will be half a day in duration.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Report of National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR)
Description:
Report 1 : The final deliverable is a report that will ensure that the NBEPR meets all user and technical requirements, and complies with local data regulations, and in line with international best practice. The consortium will work with a data scientist (funded by SANEDI) to support this process.

Report 2:This output will build on prior outputs and will finalise the functionality that the NBEPR must provide in order for it to maximize its impact. It will help to ensure the preferred NBEPR user requirements and functionality align well with reporting requirements as stated in the Draft EPC regulation, and in line with DEFF’s national emissions reporting requirements for buildings.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR) built, tested and signed off on by South African National Energy Development Institure (SANEDI), accompanied by detailed NBEPR system specification
Description: A key aspect of this PACT project is to ensure that the Energy Performance Certificate (EPC) mechanism (as delivered by the NBEPR) accounts for and reinforces the wider buildings EE framework, and collates data from buildings to seed the database. This work package will therefore see the successfully developed NBEPR becoming the first highly integrated platform to operationalize EPCs in South Africa.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Policy recommendations for the  National Building Energy Performance Register (NBEPR) delivered to enabling environment actors
Description: The policy recommendations developed will contain a set of practical interventions to ensure wide adoption of EPC mechanisms across both the public and private sector in South Africa.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Energy Performance Certificates (EPCs) issued for a sample of state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: The issuance of the first EPCs for both private and public buildings sample buildings will, in effect, bring the National Energy Act regulations for the “mandatory display and submission of EPCs for buildings” into effect. However, importantly, learnings generated in arriving at this point (i.e. through working with building owners to collect and process data into an EPC-ready format) will be consolidated for the purpose of the roadmap described in the next output.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Roadmap for replication and improving EPC compliant data collection for state- and privately-owned buildings
Description: The roadmap will incorporate lessons learned in process of collecting data and issuing EPC's, as per the previous output. It is envisaged that the roadmap will be an invaluable tool for assisting both private and public sector in obtaining EPCs for their buildings and, resultantly, being able to identify EE improvement opportunities that lead to both monetary and carbon savings

These areas may include consolidation of taxonomies for sustainable investment and ESG criteria, supporting the work of the Finance Ministry's Sustainable Finance Committee.

Project: Institutional Capacity Building Framework Program to accelerate adoption of electric mobility in public transport in India
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Medium Term (2024): Aware and empowered Kakinada city with infrastructure and institutional capacity in place to accelerate adoption of electric mobility
Description:
"1. City Officials: Capacity development of city officials from Kakinada Municipal Corporation and Kakinada Smart City Corporation etc. will provide strategic inputs on technology, planning, procurement and program design, enabling them to implement e-mobility by introduction and or replacing existing stock of vehicles used for public transport. 

2. Power Sector Stakeholders: Engineers from distribution company and officials from the state electricity regulator will use outputs to design tariff, incentives for e-mobility, support mechanisms for electric charging infrastructure. In addition, they will use outputs for enhancing renewable energy capacity in the grid.

3. Business and Entrepreneurs: Businesses will use outputs to assess risks, establish feasibility and to expand their firms to include e-mobility equipment, charging infrastructure and related services. 

4. Students and Employees: They learn new trades and skills related to e-mobility, enabling them to identify, secure green jobs and improve livelihoods.   

5. Women and Children: Women and children are key decision makers in families, especially for mobility solutions. They will use outputs to understand advantages of e-vehicles, enabling demand and driving increasing adoption.  

6. Think Tanks: They will use outputs to sensitize policy makers, regulators and media, thereby positively impacting the overall environment and demand for electric vehicles."
Implementor: Research Triangle Institute Global India Private Limited

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: The economic benefits of managed charging are widely understood by utilities, policymakers and charging network operators and suitable tariff mechanisms are identified to lay the groundwork for managed charging.
Description:
"The project will elevate the understanding of EV charging as a flexible grid resource. Through the analyses conducted, the project partners expect that BYPL and utilities across India will gain a better understanding of the economic benefits and possible pricing and policy approaches to actively and passively encourage demand management from EV charging. 

For changing network operators, the project will showcase the opportunity for viewing demand response as a means of achieving cost-savings. As Indian electricity markets evolve, the economic and policy mechanisms developed as a result of this project could pave the way for increased revenue-generating opportunities for network operators through participation in flexibility management. 

For policymakers, the project will help generate an evidence base with local data about user behaviour and implementation challenges, feeding into better-informed policymaking on critical aspects such as time of use tariffs for EV charging. This will create the policy framework to incentivize charging in a manner that helps achieve the country’s overall climate objectives of greater penetration of renewable energy. 

Ultimately, the aim is to help utilities embrace a faster and better-managed rollout of EV charging, without incurring expensive upgrades to their distribution infrastructure."

Project: Utility led smart electric vehicle charging for demand response and grid management in New Delhi, India
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Utilities can send signals to a network of chargers to manage the electricity demand from EV charging using a protocol that is suitable for India and can be nationally scaled.
Description:
"Any managed charging implementation requires two key elements. First, a transport layer in the form of wifi or cellular connection which can help achieve 2-way communication between the utility systems and a network of chargers. Second, a suitable messaging protocol or standard, which serves as the language that helps the charging devices of 3-wheelers and 4-wheelers to understand and execute the instructions from the utility's system. 

The project will establish how a distribution utility can bidirectionally communicate with a network of chargers. By demonstrating this in the Indian context, the project will help BYPL and other utility stakeholders develop an in-depth understanding of the protocols available, the demand response capabilities afforded, and technical requirements in terms of the utility's back-office systems. It will help utilities better appreciate the possibilities and limitations of managed charging. 

The project will help also enhance mutual understanding between utilities and charging network operators for each other’s limitations and motivations. Through the project’s activities, it is anticipated that a foundation will be established for vehicle grid integration and vehicle to grid pilots, paving the way for more advanced grid technologies and a resilient, flexible, and cleaner electric grid in India."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Electrification of public transport and intermediate public transport at a local level providing sustainable, affordable and inclusive low carbon mobility
Description:
"The project outputs would be of relevance to the local authorities in both the cities. In case of Ahmedabad, the project outputs would be useful for carrying out bus electrification by procuring buses, setting up supporting infrastructure and securing state government collaboration for policy interventions and funding support. Further in Mehsana, the electrification strategy of IPT will help to decarbonize as well as to recognize and improve the existing IPT as a PT and therefore it would be useful for the IPT operator/drivers, city authority as well as users.
 
The project has significant focus on developing strategies that facilitate improving the present PT/IPT service levels in terms of accessibility, affordability and sustainability. The city authorities can use the strategy document for planning the electric bus procurement, sourcing of funds, planning for the charging infrastructure and proceeding with the implementation. Further, the knowledge products developed will be disseminated in the form of workshops and training and creation of stakeholder’s networks, all contributing towards the capacity building of the involved stakeholders. The importance of bottom up approach, stakeholder networks, inclusivity and city level long term strategy development mechanism are a few noteworthy aspects contributing towards the planning machinery of the city."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Mainstreaming of women in public transport and IPT services securing livelihoods and improving safety levels for women passengers
Description:
"According to the study by Mckinsey Global Institute (The power of parity: Advancing women’s equality in India, 2015), Indian women contributed just 17 percent of national GDP, less than half the global average of 37 percent. By mainstreaming women in operation of public transport and intermediate public transport systems in the case cities, the project aims to not just provide a livelihood opportunity but also promote safety and security in the system for women users. Ultimately, strategies developed as part of this project are an attempt to improve accessibility and safety for women in transport. 

Outputs would be relevant for the city authorities and public transport agencies while they plan to implement and bring women into service delivery. This outcome is expected to build capacities of women as they participate as workforce with the support of local authority and NGOs that would work with women to organize capacity building and training activities for them."

Project: Strategy and Action Plan for Electrification of Public Transport and Intermediate Public Transport in the Indian Cities
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Capacity building of the local authorities to sustain actions towards de-carbonizing urban mobility through public transport and IPT electrification
Description:
"Government of India has been promoting electric mobility through various policies and regulatory measures. At city level, the translation of these policies has been limited in the form of standalone plans. This project of electrification strategy and action plan is a comprehensive and multi-pronged approach towards a seamless transition to electric mobility in PT and IPT mode segments. Therefore, the project is developed keeping in view the capacity building and strengthening initiatives for local authorities to sustain actions that promote sustainable transport in the cities. 

The capacity building workshops and training sessions to be undertaken as part of this project is expected to develop competencies and skills of the trainees enabling them to continue with this initiative of PT electrification beyond the project.

The decision support framework along with training modules developed as part of this project will help other city authorities, public transport agencies and IPT operators to electrification strategy for their respective cities. Capacity in terms of sensitization towards climate change, opportunity to transform the PT and IPT segment through electrification, directing urban mobility towards clean energy and to establish the need of mainstreaming women in service delivery."

Project: South Africa Skill share: Hydrogen Society Roadmap
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Creation of hydrogen roadmap and policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa
Description: Building on the MEL skills enhanced in-country, the DSI and its partners will: develop a robust, implementable, and measurable Hydrogen Society Roadmap that enables delivery of the associated economic, social (including GESI), environmental and climate outcomes; enhance cross-sectoral knowledge about hydrogen; and set the policy framework for the development of the hydrogen economy in South Africa.

Project: Skill share: Colombia Climate Physical Risks and Financial Stability
Description_new: NA

Description: Building on the adoption of scenarios and top-down stress testing methodology, the Banco de Republica and Superintendencia Financiera will be able to support other Colombian financial institutions (other state agencies, research centres and the private sector) in having a better understanding of climate change risks so they can include them in their risk management strategies. This would support new policy making and in turn shape financial flows to reduce emissions for lower carbon growth.

Project: Building a sustainable and scalable low carbon future in Mexico<U+200B>

Result_Title: Regulator and finance professionals with increased capacity in the green market

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Ride-hailing operators and the Jakarta Government commit the resources necessary to implement the action plan and timetable to electrify ride hailing fleets in Greater Jakarta Area and include the timetable and roadmap in their planning document
Description:
"1. The ride-hailing operator team will rely on the fleet electrification planning documents in the following years after this technical assistance project is completed, considering the future changes in the company’s ecosystem, business plans, or other internal or external factors. 
2. The ride-hailing operator team will be able to identify and develop new business models, contracting practices, or partnerships (e.g. with utility provider companies) to ensure the economical sustainability of fleet electrification and possible infrastructure provision, guided by the investment plan devised in this project.
3. The Government of Jakarta and BPTJ establish a local task force on electric mobility which continues the tasks and responsibilities devised for this project.
4. The Government of Jakarta and the Government of Indonesia will use the fleet electrification timetable to push infrastructure provision by PLN and implement supportive actions e.g. opening up access of government-owned land and building assets for charging facilities
5. PLN/State Utility Company will use the electric fleet deployment roadmap to develop a charging infrastructure and grid supply plan. 
6.Charging infrastructure providers will use the fleet deployment roadmap to develop investment plans on charging facilities for e-motorcycle
7.The ride-hailing drivers will have the skills necessary to operate and maintain e-motorcycle"

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: The Government of DKI Jakarta, the national government, and other local governments issue policy packages and plan investment needed to support motorcycle ride hailing fleet electrification
Description:
"1. The Government of Indonesia streamlines existing policies and develops national policies on ride-hailing electrification, guided by the policy recommendations presented in the report. The policy package could include fiscal and non-fiscal incentives for the supply and demand side, ride hailing fleet electrification mandates, and green procurement schemes.
2. The Government of Jakarta uses the policy recommendation document to create supportive policies and give non-fiscal and fiscal incentives needed. In addition to policies which directly impact the deployment of ride-hailing e-motorcycle and the provision of supporting infrastructure, the non-fiscal policies such as the implementation of Low Emission Zones, inclusive complete street improvements for e-motorcycle, or priority passenger pickup zones for e-motorcycle will also give impact to the air quality and GHG reduction and more sustainable mobility.
3. The Government of Jakarta set a ride hailing electrification target based on the developed roadmap and timetable document.
4.The Government of Indonesia and other local governments could also use the policy recommendation document to develop national and local policies. Moreover, they can also utilize the TCO and environmental benefit calculation tool to adjust the policies and develop a timeline based on national or citywide GHG reduction objectives and local contexts affecting e-motorcycle TCO."

Project: Action Plan for Electrification of Two Wheelers in Jakarta
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: State Electricity Company (PLN) addresses the grid issues related to the additional demand given the large uptake of e-motorcycle by ride hailing according to the roadmap and timetable and pursue more sustainable energy source for their grid supply
Description:
"PLN as the single entity to provide electricity in Indonesia will plan grid supply provided and ensure the stability of grid to accommodate the additional demand from e-motorcycle uptake by ride hailing fleets. The roadmap and timetable should be put into consideration when planning their 10-year electricity supply plan. The PLN will pay particular attention to certain areas projected to have more additional demand and prone to grid instability, since the demand of EV charging tends to be concentrated in certain areas.

One of the strongest rationales for electric vehicle development is its ability to mitigate emissions in the transport sector. However, GHG reduction measures should be seen as a well-to-wheel approach, hence it should include reductions of upstream emissions from electricity generation by introducing more aggressive renewable energy mix policies. Considering the forecast of electricity needed for e-bus operation and policy recommendations on well-to-wheel emission reduction, PLN will devise strategic and operational plans to increase sustainable energy mix in their electricity supply."

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Transjakarta fleet electrification by 2030 and increased mobility and accessibility for women, low-income, and marginalized communities.
Description:
"Transjakarta will use the timetable and investment plan to plan their transition to electric buses and have the capacity to iterate the fleet electrification planning documents. They will be able to develop new business models, contracting practices, partnerships, and internal capacity building to ensure the economical sustainability of fleet electrification, guided by the investment plan from this project. They will use inputs from GESI community groups to ensure the continued incorporation of accessibility and safety concerns in implementation plans.

The Government will use the roadmap and investment plan to develop subsidy schemes, commit sufficient funding to subsidize the operation of electric fleets, incorporate electrification plans in Transjakarta’s Key Performance Indicators in their contractual document, and establish a task force to continue the tasks of the PIU devised for this project.

PLN will use the deployment roadmap to develop charging infrastructure provision plan and grid supply plan.
The National Government, Government of Jakarta, and local governments will have the guidance to develop the policies and subsidies to support electrification and will have a reference document to set electrification targets. Moreover, they can utilize the calculation tool to adjust the policies and develop a timeline considering GHG reduction objectives and local contexts."

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: The bus operators will have the capacity to shift to electric buses including choosing the most reliable and suitable buses and charging technology for their operations, as well as providing the charging infrastructure at their depots.
Description: The main beneficiary of this outcome are the bus operators. They will use the timetable and investment plan document to prepare the new business model and financial model to shift from ICE buses to e-buses. Given the capacity building programs in Output 4, bus operators will also have the staff who have the capacity to maintain the electric fleet. The bus operators can also replicate the capacity building programs to their existing and future maintenance staff. Based on the charging plans, bus operators will be able to plan investments on depo charging infrastructure, including determining the technology and number of chargers and conduct depo retrofit to accommodate the chargers. Bus operators will also have knowledge to choose the bus technology which suits their operational requirement and pursue collaboration with the bus manufacturers to maintain the buses, especially maintaining the battery performance.

Project: Building Capacity and an Action Plan to Scale up Transjakarta E buses
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: State Utility Company (PLN) addresses the grid issues related to e-buses and pursues more sustainable energy sources.
Description:
"Based on the fleet deployment and grid supply plan documents in Output 2, the state utility company (PLN) will ensure that their grid supply is sufficient for the large scale e-bus deployment, and address grid stability issues which is currently still experienced often in the Jakarta area. 

One of the strongest rationales for electric vehicle development is its ability to mitigate emissions in the transport sector. However, GHG reduction measures should be seen as a well-to-wheel approach, hence it should include reductions of upstream emissions from electricity generation by introducing more aggressive renewable energy mix policies. Considering the forecast of electricity needed for e-bus operation and policy recommendations on well-to-wheel emission reduction, PLN will devise strategic and operational plans to increase sustainable energy mix in their electricity supply."

Project: Development of an EV Financing Tool and Business Model to Enable the Scaling up of EV Uptake
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Enhanced and sustained action on climate change - reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality resulting from the increased uptake of EVs and e-mobility solutions
Description:
The creation of an enabling environment for electrified transport solutions including capacity and awareness, business models, and financing tools to support individual public transport operators, MSMEs, cooperatives, and large urban mobility service providers to scale up their EV uptake in Bangladesh. This would contribute to the achievement of the overall programme outcome of achieving reduction in emissions from transport and improved air quality. 

The project outputs contributing to the achievement of this outcome include:
(i) Output 1: Knowledge Product on the EV Financing Tool, would be used by the Government of Bangladesh, Development Partners and FIs as the fact-finding and evidence report used in the roll-out the EV Finance tool. This would provide affordable and accessible finance to businesses and facilitate the transition to EVs. 
(ii) Output 2: Capacity development of MSMEs through the business support services to support the transition to EVs in their existing business models as well as to develop new EV enabled business models. These supported MSMEs would form the core body of ‘champions’/ ‘knowledge disseminators’ to achieve sustained reductions in emissions. 
(iii) Output 3: Sensitising MaaS providers and partner corporates on the importance and business value of integrating sustainable transport into their business strategies.

Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Policy adaption based on the South African Renewable Energy Master Plan
Description:
A SAREM process can impact South African policy to set a path for renewable energy market expansion over the next 30 years as determined by the Department of Minerals and Energy, Department of Trade Industry and Competition and Department of Environmental Affairs

1) Growth of local renewable energy manufacturing - South Africa becomes an exporter of locally manufactured renewable energy components

Description: The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of the stewarship/engagement process. Asset owners and managers will adopt engagement practices more broadly. This will lead to change in the activities of investee companies, or if no action is taken on emissions, to divestment. Additionally, The ESG capacity of asset managers and asset owners is enhanced through a better understanding of how to overcome the product and data related challenges to scale ESG across different asset classes and across public and private markets. With this knowledge, the investor community in China increases their portfolio allocations towards greener investments and reduced exposure to high-emitting activities.

Project: Operationalising Energy Performance Certificates in South Africa
Description_new: NA
Result_Title: Wide-scale adoption of the EPC mechanism and mainstreamed energy efficiency performance management throughout the built environment, driving improved economy-wide energy efficiency
Description: A register of all buildings that have obtained EPCs, along with their actual EPC, will be made publicly available through the NBEPR. EPC certificates will be valid for 5 years, after which a new EPC audit will be required and a new certificate issued. It is anticipated that only at this 5-year interval that improvements to individual buildings energy efficiency will captured in the NBEPR, and that the NBEPR will be able to monitor building by building EE improvements.

Between 1 and 5 EE related policies have been influenced by NBEPR data, and between 1 and 5 EE programmes have been informed by NBEPR data
